Entries.default: You stumble into a room only brightly lit in comparison to the tunnel from which you came. A man with soft features and round eyes blinks mutely before clearing his throat.
"Don't matter none, you're finally here is all. Crowd gets restless waiting. You best get out to the pit."
"I think you may have confused me with someone else."
"Where am I?"
"You're in challenger's chamber, yeah? That makes you challenger. Beyond that? Don't matter none."
He stares blankly at you.
"See me in action? This isn't a brothel, is it?"
"I left my pack back in the cave. It has all my best potions."
"Look, you're all wobbly in knees in face of death, I understand. But you should have thought of that before you entered arena!"
The aumaua stabs a finger at the archway, then takes a step back, brushing his hand along a column as he does so. The door closes between you.
He sighs, pulls a pouch from his belt, and shoves it into your hands.
"Everyone champs at the bit to see you in action!"

"Humaire wants to bend your ear. You go find her in Hall of Memories, straight past me."

He frowns, rubs the back of his head, and clears his throat.
"Also, er, sorry about before."
"Ekera, the wall! What even is down there?" He cranes his neck, peering over your shoulder.
"Wait, what?"
"Who are you?"

"Pit! Go out to pit!"

He jerks a thumb at a nearby door.
"That don't matter none, neither. I'm the kith supposed to get you before the people."

"You having second thoughts about the rite? Stop. It's too late. "

He gestures sharply at the portal behind him.
"I'm not going into your damned pit!"
"What's going on here?"
[Say nothing.]
"Next time... forget less!"
"What? No! Just, get out there!"
"You're going to put on a show's what."
"Fine! Don't go in, then! Just disappear back into your hole!"
Huffing, he stomps back through the doorway and brushes his hand along a column. The door closes between you.
The guard from before sheepishly rubs the back of his hairless head.
"No apology needed, but point me to whomever is in charge."
"I need to speak with the person in charge."
"Oh. Oh! Then praise be to Toamowhai, for there's a warrior's spirit within you! You've come to right place to slake that thirst!"
"Yes, of course. Toamowhai truly rules this place, but Humaire deals with matters that pertain to lowly kith."

"You are alive - praise Toamowhai! I did not uh... I had not uh... I should have verified you were intending to join our Crucible games instead of... uh...eh..." 

The guard stomps his foot as his words end in stammering.
"Instead of throwing me into your blood sport pit?"
"Last I saw her, Humaire was upstairs, watching the fights. You should speak to her. She will know more than me."
"I haven't had that much fun since the last time I killed something."
"Some challengers, they hesitate before the moment of battle, only then understanding what comes upon them." He swallows.
"Your sincere confusion, I thought cold feet. I apologize a hundred times! But you stand here now. It must be as Toamowhai wills!"
"Ekera."
"Wouldn't be a problem if it were. Kazuwari's hurtin' for a fine brothel."
"All brothels are arenas, captain, but not all arenas are brothels. This is a lesson better learned early, I say."
"It's got the same scent as the Wild Mare, don't it? Like upscale stables."
"Friendly, isn't he?"
"I'll let you handle this one." Konstanten puts as much of you between himself and the man as possible.
"Just point me towards the nearest drink."
[Say nothing.]
"It is Corrin you want, then. You go find him near stairs." He points northward through the chamber.
"But you should speak with Humaire."
"Aye, seconded thrice over. Nothing be working up an old salt's thirst like defying death."
"You'd better put down coin for that ale you owe me while you're at it."

"We're a little more than just 'some challengers,' but it's cute that you'd think that." 

Maia glances up from oiling her gun long enough to smile.
His scarred face split by a wide grin, Rekke nods vigorously.
"Aye, lass. Wouldn't have you be thinking me a debtor."
"That's about the closest thing you'll get to an apology around here."
"Looks like you can hold your own in a fight. That's great! Really useful for not dying."
"Now you're speaking my language, captain!"
"Best not to argue with him, Watcher. Some of these folks got short fuses and itchy sword arms."
"Welcome to the Temple of Toamowhai, Watcher! Home sweet home."
